sentence.Network_en: Before the Chronicle I used to take the Guardian.

sentence.Network_en: Her latest novel is a chronicle of life in a Devon village.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的最近一部小说是德文郡一个小村庄的生活记事。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French cronicle, variant of Old French cronique, via Latin from Greek khronika 'annals', from khronikos (see chronic)

entry.tran: 按时间顺序记述(或播放)
entry.def: To chronicle a series of events means to write about them or show them in broadcasts in the order in which they happened.

example.ex: The series chronicles the everyday adventures of two eternal bachelors.
example.tran: 这个系列剧按照时间顺序记述了两个老光棍每天的奇遇。

entry.def: A chronicle is an account or record of a series of events.

example.tran: 这套大部头的拿破仑时代编年史

entry.def: Chronicle is sometimes used as part of the name of a newspaper.

means.word_mean: 1. a record or narrative description of past events;

sentences.sentence: "he gave an inaccurate account of the plot to kill the president"

means.word_mean: 1. record in chronological order; make a historical record

stems_affixes.word_buile: chrono=chron时间+logical逻辑的→根据时间的逻辑来排列
syn共同+chron时间+ous……的→adj.同期的;同步的
chron时间+ology学科→有关时间的学科
chrono=chron时间+meter测量→测量时间→记时器
syn共同+chron时间+ize表动词→时间相同→同时发生

Sentence.sentence: A chronicle professor, Henry Louis Gates, recently studied are search project looking into 19th century African-American fiction and poetry.
The writers of Generation O (short for Obama), a new Newsweek blog that seeks to chronicle the lives of a group of young Obama supporters, want to answer that question.

sentences.en: I heard the sad chronicle of his accidents.
sentences.cn: 我听到了关于他出事的悲惨经过。

sentences.en: History chronicles important events of the past.
sentences.cn: 历史记载了历代重要的事件。
